name: Elven Guardian - Rogue 17 / Wizard 1 / Arcane Archer 22
author: Vinleboiteux

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
With the proliferation of archer builds lately, I have decided that it is high time I finally post a build that I have been sitting on for 6 years.  Tyr Templar and I had exchanged a lot of PMs with her helping me polish this pair of builds.  The txt files are dated mid-December 2012, so I don't even remember why every detail is exactly the way it is.  She had written a story for it, but she said that she was planning to post an archer build, too, so my last PM to her was asking if I should use the story in my build or was she planning on using it for hers, but she never answered, so the build never got posted.

This build has a lot going for it, great AB, decent AC, Epic Dodge, Uncanny Dodge to protect the DEX AC, and nice Rogue skills, including UMD.  It comes in 2 flavors, PvP and PvM.  Much belatedly, here they are:

Elven Guardian PvP (Rogue 17 / Wizard 1 / Arcane Archer 22)
Elf, Any Alignment
Playable 1 - 40, PvP

Abilities:
STR: 12
DEX: 18 (34)
CON: 14
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA: 8

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
That's because we're all playing on BSK and can get away with it.

This is a really cool build. I assume the defensive parts are so you can maintain SA range. Are the extra rogue levels for more e damage well? I figure you can give up 3 rogue levels for 3 aa levels or something.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: That is my guess, throw darkness around and begin sniping with ultra-vision or something, while the listen-focusses are taking advantage of the Elf's permanent detect mode to sense any other sneaks in the area.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: The extra Rogue levels are for Epic Dodge and to be a good Rogue as well as a good archer, with stronger sneaks and more skills.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A great combo this Rogue/ Wizard/ AA.
I like the different nuances comparing the PvP and PvM builds.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content:
Hey everyone,

Looking at arcane archer builds. Stumbled on this one. Was just wondering about the Weapon finesse feat in the PvM version. Is it in case you ever have to melee something ? Just curious if its a prereq for something thats escaping me.

Ty

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Vinleboiteux wrote: ↑
Apr 07, 2024
Hey everyone,

Looking at arcane archer builds. Stumbled on this one. Was just wondering about the Weapon finesse feat in the PvM version. Is it in case you ever have to melee something ? Just curious if its a prereq for something thats escaping me.

Ty
Heya!

I like to take Weapon Finesse with my archers too if I can spare the feat. A lot of times there are tight hallways, small rooms, etc.. where you don't have a lot of room to maneuver. In those cases, finesse does help a lot!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Max is exactly right about why Weapon Finesse is there.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content: Ty :)

posts.content: Taking this guy for a spin in Aeilund :)

posts.content: I remember taking an AA, similar to this one, through Aielund.  I must say that it was challenging at times.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Vinleboiteux wrote: ↑

We talking solo right ?
Well that depends on how you play. For me, Aielund companions just offer too much to ignore - better AI, quality banter, possible romance, side quests, covering up for being a dumb-ass, etc. Some players are more - being nice - self-motivated. Up to you, really: it'll make no real difference to your final xp.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content: Yes I know. Just wondering if the challenge being AA was also from being solo.

posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote: ↑
Apr 13, 2024
SpoilerPlaying Aielund with an archer becomes much easier once you can afford the boots of travelling
edit: fixed the scroller
You mean haste ones ? Don’t remember when they start showing up.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: The boots of travel are not full-fledged haste.  They only increase your movement speed.  That's still nice to have, and handy for an archer who wants to stay out of melee range.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: They increase the movement speed as if they were boots of permanent Expeditious retreat. When your character equips them, they give a speed increase to the entire party.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content: Oh don’t remember coming across those.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: They can be bought in the town where you start, from the leather and cloth merchant couple next door to the mayor, but it will be a while before and afford them.  I remember getting them in a random drop once.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content:
Just found them. The speed increase is in the description and not in the properties which lists only +1 dodge AC. Thats why I missed them. Ok ty people! Now i’ll stop hijacking this build thread.

Its a cool build I am enjoying the mix of rogue skill set with AA dmg. Can’t wait for more AA levels :)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I also love the ranged sneak attacks.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content: I agree ! Though sometimes they are jot triggering and I’m not sure why. If an enemie is hitting someone else and they are not immune to it. I should be sneak attacking. But sometimes I’m not. I gave up trying to figure it out.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: For a ranged sneak attack, you have to be within 30 feet.  Maybe you weren't.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content: Yes maybe thats it. Trying to be closer. No clue what 30 feet actually represents in game.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Vinleboiteux wrote: ↑
Apr 21, 2024
Yes maybe thats it. Trying to be closer. No clue what 30 feet actually represents in game.
If you were a human character, it'd be about 5xheight, but horizontal (obvs), so maybe add another for being an elf.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content:
Ok distance was the issue ! Now that I’m paying attention I am getting way more sneak attacks. Also dmg really picked up at level 15 with my third attack !
Ok I’m not a builder, but I am curious, if at level 15 I just got my AB to 11 will I be hitting 16 at level 20 for 4 attacks per round with 4 leveks of AA and one Rogue level left ?

posts.author: BluntAxe
posts.content:
Vinleboiteux wrote: ↑
Apr 24, 2024
Ok I’m not a builder, but I am curious, if at level 15 I just got my AB to 11 will I be hitting 16 at level 20 for 4 attacks per round with 4 leveks of AA and one Rogue level left ?
If you are following the build plan then yes!  It'll be the 10 LVL of rogue which will add +1 to BAB (rogue does not add to BAB on the 1st LVL of each group of 4 before character level 20) and AA will add 1 per level - Total BAB by level 20 will be 16 and therefore 4 attacks per round.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content:
Just not sure how its calculated. So if I go 10 x 0.75 (rogue) + 0,5 (wiz) + 9 x 1 ( AA) I get AB of 17.

But if I just add whats left 11 (current AB) + 4 x 1 (AA) + 0,75 (rogue) i get 15.75.

I assume the first way is how its calculated ? I’m curious how its done and not doubting the actual build here :)

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
AA is a warrior class and gets +1BAB on every level pre epic.

Rogue is "3/4 BAB class" and gets +0 BAB on class level 1, 5, 9, 13 and 17 taken pre epic and +1 BAB on class level 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 10...etc. taken pre epic.
So the 10th rogue level will grant a +1BAB.

In epic levels all classes get +1BAB every second level.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
The 1/2 AB classes, like Wizard, give you a +1 BAB on even levels of the class, so no on levels 1, 3, and 5, but yes on levels 2, 4, and 6.  The 3/4 AB classes, like Rogue, give you +1 BAB on all levels except the first one in each group of 4, so no on levels 1, 5, 9, 13, and 17, but yes on all the others.  Full AB classes, like AA, give you +1 BAB on all levels.  All of this applies only up to level 20.  Starting at level 21, all builds, no matter what classes, get +1 BAB only on even levels, so the highest BAB possible at level 40 is 30.

At level 20, this build will have 7 BAB from the 10 levels of Rogue (missing ones from the 1st, 5th, and 9th levels of Rogue), 0 BAB from the 1 level of Wizard, and 9 BAB from the 9 levels of AA, for a total of 7 + 0 + 9 = 16 BAB at level 20, and 26 BAB at level 40.  This will give you 4 attacks, +1 if you have Haste, and another +1 if you activate Rapid Fire mode, for up to 6 attacks.

Also, you can't add levels of different classes, a mistake I made early on.  Here's an example:  At level 20, if you have Monk 11, Fighter 4, and SD 5, you might think that the 16 levels of 3/4 classes would give you 12 BAB and 4 levels of fighter will add 4 BAB to make 16 BAB, right?  Wrong!  You lose a BAB at Monk levels 1, 5, and 9, and also at SD levels 1 and 5, which lowers your BAB at level 20 to only 15, so you don't get that last attack.  To fix this, follow the Rule of Fours, with Monk 12, Fighter 4, SD 4 at level 20, waiting until after level 20 for that 5th level of SD for Defensive Roll, to qualify for Epic Dodge.

EDIT:  I should have looked at the next page to see that Mick had already offered an explanation.

FURTHER EDIT:  It might look like this build violates the Rule of Fours, with 10 pre-epic levels of Rogue, but 2 of the AA levels, with full BAB, complete the set that started with Rogue 9 and 10, and another 3 levels of AA complete another set of 4 that started with the Wizard level, leaving 4 more AA levels for the final set of 4.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Very well explained Empyre!

I often use the 8/2/10 split pre epic for Arcane archers. Eg Rogue 8 (or Monk 8), Wizard 2, AA 10 and get BAB 17 at level 20.

posts.author: Vinleboiteux
posts.content: That clears things up alot thanks guys :)
